There's a place out here called CRAS (Conservatory of Recording Arts and Sciences) that's really well known nationally, they promise to make you a professional in 11 months, but your mileage may vary.
A few of my professors used to teach there, but a lot of them left because they didn't like some of the ideologies enforced.
My studio recording class professor was actually one of their founding members.
So there's a bit of a rivalry between the schools to put out the better engineers.
Also it's fuckin' expensive.
It's an 11 month course work, but costs three times as much as mine which takes two years to complete.
Honestly, I don't have any kind of money for that shit. Everyone I know had their money go to shit cuz loans for college

but that's about it
